microstructure: bcc solid solution with little vanadium rich phase and fine intermetallic phase presented dendritic structure
evidence: A new refractory alloy HfNbSi 0.5 TiVZr was synthesized by induction levitation melting with the aim to achieve an excellent strength and toughness balance of the Hf-Nb-Ti-Zr based alloy. The as-cast alloy with density of ρ=7.75g/cm 3 and microhardness of H v =464 had the microstructure consisting of bcc solid solution with little vanadium rich phase and fine intermetallic phase presented dendritic structure.

microstructure: bcc solid solution with little vanadium rich phase and fine silicide of Hf and Zr
evidence: The yield strength is 1540MPa as cast and 1483MPa after annealed, and the ductility is 16.8% and 9.5% respectively. The yield strength and maximum pressure stress decline as the temperature increase, at 1073K, the yield strength was 371MPa as cast and 102MPa after annealed respectively
